variants.Description in input context: M26I mutation reduces DJ-1 expression, particularly in a null background (knockout mouse embryonic fibroblasts).
C106A mutation of the central redox site specifically abolished binding to ASK1 and the cytoprotective activity of DJ-1.
Mutations of peripheral redox sites (C46A and C53A) and M26I also led to constitutive ASK1 binding.
Cytoprotective [wt]DJ-1 bound to the ASK1 N terminus (which is known to bind another negative regulator, thioredoxin 1), whereas [M26I]DJ-1 bound to aberrant C-terminal site(s).
